intro: Chusquea lehmannii subsp. farinosa, commonly known as the farinose bamboo, is a member of the grass family Poaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. This subspecies is characterized by its slender, erect culms and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high elevations. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species within its native habitat.
